page.title: 19Wragby Then And Now
page.content: We talked to a 75 year_old who had lived in Wragby all his life.He thought{the biggest change he had seen {was from using trains to buses to go {anywhere.}Passenger trains stopped running in the 1950's,although freight was carried for a few more years.The roads were narrow and even had grass growing down the middle in places. He started work when he was our age (10) and on Sundays went for a swim in a pool made by damming the beck.Each year,there was a Sunday School trip to Mablethorpe or Skegness and everybody went on a special train.Everything in Wragby closed down for the day as no_ one wanted to miss the treat. During the 2nd. war,there were lots of army huts where the school is now and a gun on a concrete tower in the Market Place. {In 1920,the population was about 400
